evidence: Then, in Section 2, we’ll explore some of the most important properties of the Fourier transform. These properties aren’t just mathematical curiosities - they’re practical tools used in signal processing, imaging, and many other fields.
Today's lecture will cover the Fourier transform, which is a key concept in signal processing and medical imaging.
We'll explore the Fourier transform properties and their practical applications in signal processing and imaging.
We'll extend our thinking to higher dimensions, showing how the Fourier transform applies to images and beyond.
By the end of this lecture, you should understand the mathematical structure of the Fourier transform and its real-world value in medical imaging.

Then, in Section 2, we'll explore some of the most important properties of the Fourier transform. These properties aren't just mathematical curiosities - they're practical tools used in signal processing, imaging, and many other fields.
